image.altText: Aerial image of Andgar's Dublin piggery in South Australia taken by drone in June 2025.

props.synopsis: Emergency crews are at the scene of a fire at a large piggery north of Adelaide that is subject to cruelty allegations.

title.children: Hundreds of pigs feared dead in fire at SA piggery

image.altText: Two female students in grey uniforms look at a laptop on a table

props.synopsis: A ChatGPT-style app to be rolled out at all South Australian high schools next term has been welcomed by tech experts, who are also warning its use should be carefully managed.

title.children: AI app rolls out in SA schools as tech experts warn against 'dumbing down'

image.altText: Bare branches covering a large beige building in the background

props.synopsis: The actions of a man who imported a child-like sex doll to his family home have been labelled "morally and legally repugnant" by a District Court judge.

title.children: Man jailed until at least 2028 for importing child-like sex doll

image.altText: A portrait photo of Max Basheer.

props.synopsis: Max Basheer — the football administrator who oversaw the creation of the Adelaide Crows and the purpose-built stadium Football Park — has died aged 98.

title.children: 'SA giant' who championed entry of Crows, Port into the AFL remembered

image.altText: Edan van Haren as a young boy smiling, wearing a striped T-shirt.

props.synopsis: Edan van Haren, a victim of child predator Maurice Van Ryn, says legal loopholes are allowing the confessed paedophile to protect his assets in superannuation to avoid paying compensation.

title.children: Paedophile declares bankruptcy to avoid paying $1.4m in damages

image.altText: The 'pass go' square on a monopoly game board.

props.synopsis: Political parties usually get in trouble for breaking their election promises. But what happens when they keep a promise that never actually existed?

title.children: SA government error in your favour — collect $1 million

image.altText: Wombats in Robe

props.synopsis: A wombat has made its home in the main street of Robe, evidence of an influx of the animals in the South Australian fishing town.

title.children: Wombat makes home in main street bowls club amid habitat loss

image.altText: A beekeeper with a bee smoker.

props.synopsis: Beekeepers on Kangaroo Island are demanding that biosecurity measures be boosted to prevent a deadly parasite from wiping out the island's world-famous bee sanctuary.

title.children: World-famous bee sanctuary under threat from destructive parasite

image.altText: A black-and-white photo showing shirtless soldiers carrying another soldier on a stretcher near a large fig tree.

props.synopsis: Many of the Rats of Tobruk hailed from the Eyre Peninsula and, after years of work, their legacy has been commemorated by a very special tree taking root.

title.children: Tobruk fig planted in honour of the Rats of the Eyre Peninsula

image.altText: an aerial view of a car park after a baby girl died after being hit by a car and another child hospitalised

props.synopsis: Emergency crews were called to the car park of Minto Mall about 3:30pm on Monday afternoon, where the baby and five-year-old child had been struck by a car.

title.children: Baby girl dies, child hospitalised after being hit by car at Sydney car park

image.altText: Various items in a state of disarray

props.synopsis: Photos have revealed a chaotic scene inside the Porepunkah property where Dezi Freeman is alleged to have shot and killed two police officers.

title.children: Inside the property where two Victoria Police officers were killed

image.altText: A man looks ahead with a serious expression. Behind him is a wall of a brick house.

props.synopsis: The controversial church offered to settle with Mick Dover over his allegations of abuse, but only if he signed a non-disclosure agreement and agreed not to disparage them in any way.

title.children: 'Not worth it. I'd rather tell you': Mick Dover turned down $1m to do this interview

image.altText: ANZ logo outside a bank.

props.synopsis: ANZ bank has agreed to a record penalty with the corporate regulator over its dealings with about 65,000 customers, as well as the federal government.

title.children: 'Grubby': ANZ faces record penalty for ripping off customers and government

image.altText: A man wearing a blue suit and red tie points his finger at something

props.synopsis: The US president's threat comes after Washington DC Mayor Muriel Bowser said the district's police would not cooperate with Immigration and Customs Enforcement.

title.children: Trump vows national emergency in Washington DC over ICE dispute

image.altText: Woman stands in park with microphone in front of chest

props.synopsis: Australia's richest person, Gina Rinehart, has helped fund Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price's crowd-funded defence to a defamation action brought by the head of a Northern Territory land council.

title.children: Gina Rinehart helps fund Jacinta Nampijinpa Price's defamation defence

image.altText: Hannah Einbinder holding an Emmy smiling at the camera, people blurred behind her

props.synopsis: From a rallying political cry from Hacks star Hannah Einbinder to standing ovations for Stephen Colbert, here are your Emmys 2025 key moments.

title.children: Expletives on live television and some upset wins. Here's how the Emmys played out

image.altText: A man speaks with his hands to another man.

props.synopsis: A Gold Coast musician approached by a man he knew from a local bar went on to front a trading company, later accused of defrauding millions from ordinary Australian investors.

title.children: Musician turned 'CEO' confronted over investment fraud allegations

image.altText: A supermarket aisle

props.synopsis: When you're at the supermarket, do you wonder how much much tuna you're getting in a can? A series of popular social media has been comparing how much food there is in some packaged items.

title.children: Why your tin of tuna may only contain 35pc fish

image.altText: A young John Farnham with long hair, smiling and wearing a leather jacket.

props.synopsis: Whispering Jack: The John Farnham Musical is one of 13 plays coming to Sydney Theatre Company next year, alongside shows starring David Wenham and Miranda Otto.

title.children: John Farnham's comeback becomes main-stage musical as Whispering Jack turns 40

image.altText: A mugshot of a young caucasian man with brown hair

props.synopsis: Investigators are working to piece together why Tyler Robinson allegedly scaled a rooftop at Utah Valley University during an outdoor event and shot Mr Kirk in the neck at long range.

title.children: Alleged Kirk shooter Tyler Robinson 'not cooperating' with authorities

image.altText: Anthony Albanese standing in front of an Australian flag

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has blamed pro-Palestinian protesters for the closure of his electorate office in Sydney's inner west, but the landlord says there were multiple reasons behind the decision to discontinue the long-standing lease.

title.children: 'Got a bit intense': Church axes PM's office lease in Sydney's inner west

image.altText: Aerial image of Andgar's Dublin piggery in South Australia taken by drone in June 2025.

props.synopsis: Emergency crews are at the scene of a fire at a large piggery north of Adelaide that is subject to cruelty allegations.

title.children: Hundreds of pigs feared dead in fire at SA piggery

image.altText: A man in grey suit

props.synopsis: Christian Brueckner lived in Portugal's Algarve region at the time the three-year-old vanished in 2007 and was first named as a suspect by British and German police in 2020.

title.children: Prime suspect in Madeleine McCann disappearance refuses UK police interview

image.altText: Two fighter jets flying

props.synopsis: Russia is accused of breaching Romania's airspace by sending in a kamikaze Geran-2 drone.

title.children: Second Russian violation in NATO airspace after drone intercepted over Romania

image.altText: Image of a plane taking off seen from within an empty airport terminal.

props.synopsis: A teacher from the New South Wales Central Coast has been arrested at Sydney Airport after he was charged with sexually assaulting a teenage girl.

title.children: Teacher accused of child sex offences arrested at Sydney Airport

image.altText: Two marathon runners cross the line in a tight finish to a marathon

props.synopsis: After running for more than two hours, the winner of the men's marathon at the World Athletics Championships was decided by less than a second.

title.children: Marathon runner creates history in world championship photo finish

image.altText: A man with short greying hair wearing a suit, tie and glasses holds a press conference in front of a Queensland Police backdrop.

props.synopsis: Police allege the death of a man on the Gold Coast earlier this year was an assisted suicide and are investigating the deaths of other people as far back as 2021.

title.children: Police charge man with assisting suicide while probing 20 other deaths

image.altText: An older man with white hair gets out of the driver's side of a car.

props.synopsis: Bishop Pat Power is being remembered as a much-loved Canberran who leaves a legacy of compassion and hope.

title.children: 'Supporter for the marginalised': Tireless campaigner Bishop Pat Power dies

image.altText: A woman and man with sunglasses.

props.synopsis: In 2022, the then-17-year-old broke into Ms Lovell's North Lakes home on Boxing Day night and fatally stabbed her in the chest during a struggle. He was sentenced to 14 years in jail last year, but it was reduced last month on appeal.

title.children: Attorney-general makes bid to appeal reduced sentence for Emma Lovell's killer

image.altText: Ambulances and first responders at a suburban street in daylight.

props.synopsis: A man who killed an elderly man as well as stabbing his wife and dog in a "callous and senseless act of unimaginable violence" has been sentenced to life in prison.

title.children: Teen who stabbed elderly couple at their Perth home jailed for murder

image.altText: A male protester wearing a flak jacket and carrying a shield in the middle of a protest

props.synopsis: Protesters in Nepal say their Gen Z-led movement was not just about removing one leader, but about reforming the system to ensure accountability and protect Nepal’s future.

title.children: What happens now in Nepal after new leader takes reins?

image.altText: Suryakumar Yadav and Salman Agha walk past each other

props.synopsis: Indian captain Suryakumar Yadav refuses to shake hands after his side's seven-wicket win over Pakistan at the Asia Cup in the latest controversial episode between the two rivals.

title.children: Pakistan cricketers stunned by India's handshake snub

image.altText: Arhab Haque looks down at his phone while walking out of court.

props.synopsis: An amateur mixed martial arts fighter sprayed fart gas in a fast food restaurant so he could make TikTok prank videos, a Perth court hears.

title.children: Fart gas sprayed inside Perth fast-food outlets for TikTok clout, court hears

image.altText: A woman on a man's shoulders, both smiling, out the front of a stadium. She has an Aussie flag in hand, he has a yellow wig.

props.synopsis: Largely regarded as one of the most successful modern Olympics, years of work went into ensuring Sydney could fully capitalise on its moment in the spotlight.

title.children: How the 2000 Olympics changed the face of Sydney
